tweet5.text: Which prior education have you completed?

tweet6.text: What profile (or subjects / courses) did you do in your prior education?

tweet8.text: Which study choice check activities have you done? (you can select multiple answers)

tweet9.text: What do you see yourself doing after completing the program? For example what profession or role interests you? why? and what do you hope to have learned in four years?

replies.text: After completing this study I would like to have a job within software development. I am not sure yet if i want to do sw engineering, fullstack, front-end or mainly back-end, but that's what I want to find out. I want to get more experience as a programmer to see what fits me best and ofcourse to be a better developer not just with code but also working within an agile team.

tweet11.text: How many hours do you work (approximately) a week?

tweet12.text: Do you have a hobby for example or an interest that you would like to share something about?

replies.text: As of right now my hobbys are mainly programming. I like to do side projects to learn new programming concepts or tools. Other than that an hobby a few years back was to make games on Roblox. I learned skills like photo editing, scripting and 3D modeling.

Planning: As a Scrum master I was able to plan meetings a head of time so all were attended by my (and sometimes other) teams. Motivation: I always do what I have to do, even if I don't want to do it at all.
Shyness: I tend to be shy with people I haven't met yet.
Current Skills: Because I did Software Development on the MBO, I am not new to programming and working inside a agile devOps team I also have used my skills to build and maintain a portfolio website
Time: Altough planning isn't new for me, I still have a job and have to travel a bit so I need to make sure that doesn't get in the way
